screen_desc: The screenshot displays the "Languages & Input" settings on an Android device. It shows the current language as "English (United States)" and offers options for configuring keyboards. The "Virtual keyboard" section includes Gboard and Google voice typing, while the "Physical keyboard" section lists AT Translated Set 2 and QWERTY2. There is also an "Advanced" section with further keyboard settings like pointer speed and text-to-speech tools.
history_actions: click on the Settings icon located at the upper left.
click on the "System" option located at the middle-lower part of the screen.
click on the "Languages & input" located at the upper left.
action_plan: Click on the 'Gboard' option under 'Virtual keyboard' to proceed with changing the keyboard appearance.

action_with_memory.Next Single Step Action: Click on the 'Gboard' option under 'Virtual keyboard' to proceed with changing the keyboard appearance.
